pullRequest.body:
Added the instance of TensorProduct.instCommRing.

Previously we only had the `CommRing` and `Semiring` instance; this moves an existing proof to populate the intermediate instance.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/32b21bbd-6e92-4300-82be-81e114037633/to/81809d86-5617-4cbc-a319-88247c1e052d) against commit 5541d213521e95c5b7d73066de4ad78a600e6263.

bors merge
Mathematically this looks good to me, I'll let @mattrobball decide what to do about the instances, if anything.
Mathematically this looks good to me, I'll let @mattrobball decide what to do about the instances, if anything.

I'm kicking this on the queue. Fixing the instances can happen in a follow-up PR.

bors merge
Can you explain in the PR description why these changed?
I am not sure how to explain. I had to change it because it stopped working after the introduction of the definition of tensor product for CommSemirings.

I think there's a typeclass diamond appearing here;
```
  convert IsScalarTower.right
  sorry
```
suceeds and leaves some weird goals to close.
That's what I thought. But a `by exact?` Succeeded on finding `Ideal.Quotient.isScalarTower_right`

Hmm, actually it's an inference issue elsewhere:
```lean
  convert IsScalarTower.right
  rotate_left 3
   infer_instance
   infer_instance -- fails, but `exact Ring.toSemiring` works
   infer_instance
   rfl
   rfl
   rfl
`````

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/TensorProduct): Tensor product for CommSemiring
